text:
NAEB PLACEMENT SERVICE
Anyone wishing to register with the NAEB Placement Service should
write to Mr. Robert E. Underwood* Jr., 14 Gregory Hall, Urbana,
Illinois, and the proper forms will be forwarded to you by return
mail. Also, any inquiries concerning applicants listed below
should be addressed to Mr. Underwood.
The following descriptions of personnel listed wi th us are written
by the applicants themselves, and are taken directly from the
Placement Service forms.
Jan. 1. Experienced in producing and M.C.*ing educational tele¬
casts for youngsters and adult audiences. Degrees in music and in
communications. Competent pianist and conductor. Desire position
in TV production, preferably with on-camera work.
Jan. 2. Producer, director, writer. Professional and educational
experience. Workshop founder and coordinator. University lectures.
Live TV, stage, film experience. Offer must be above $6000, Short
term production or counselling assignments.
Jan. 3. UNIV. GRAD. *54, trained for RADIO-TV. Rich exper. in
Singing, Directing, Teaching. Some Journalism. Seeks work on
Program, Commercials, Continuity, Production, etc.
Jan. 4. Former Head of TV Research & Planning at major university
desires position in educational programming. Ten years professional
experience in writing, directing, producing motion pictures, TV,
radio, both coasts and overseas.
Jan. 5. Intelligent, original young woman with extensive artistic
and scientific background, interested in educational research,
broadcasting or production. Willing and able to begin at secre¬
tarial level.
Jan. 6. Now employed in commercial radio--televisioh station,
desire to enter educational radio-television. Wide experience at
several Eastern radio stations, including two 501cw stations, and
at two television stations, one iVHF* one UHF. Harvard S.B. and an
A.M. in English. Taught English eight years, six in college, two
in prep school. Free-lance writing nationally and regionally.
Would be good suvervising students in college station. Married,
34. Need at least $5000 a year.
Jan. 7. Long record of success in curriculum-building, school
station operation and production of radio and television programs.
Interested in a position of responsibility where maturity and ex¬
perience count. Combines educational and commercial experience.
Jan. 8. Network television producer, director, writer, with five
years in television, and seven years in related media, seeks ex¬
ecutive producer position with educational television station.
